title: #381: How To Stop A Mass Shooting - Beyond Thoughts and Prayers | Uvalde School Shooting
description:
This episode is a difficult listen but an important one. We at Real Crime Profile feel so devastated, frustrated and angry about the recent events in Texas and we know many of you feel the same.

In this episode we speak from our professional experience as well as from the heart, Lisa and Laura as mother's and Jim as an uncle. Things get emotional and a little heated. We feel strongly about preventing the next shooter and protecting the public. These murders are preventable. We all need to take action. Join us for Part 2 of our discussion.

Again, we extend our deepest sympathy and sorrow for the 21 victims who lost their lives on May 24th, 2022 at the Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas. We are holding their families and community in our hearts along with the other victims who were injured and survived. 

#MaleViolence #MaleEntitlement #ChildrenMatter #WomenMatter #EnoughIsEnough #MassShooting

Their names were:

#EvaMireles

#XavierLopez

#JoseFlores

#IrmaGarcia

#NevaehBravo

#EllieGarcia

#TessMata

#AlexandriaRubio

#JacklynCazares

#JailahSilguero

#JayceLuevanos

#MirandaMathis

#AmerieJoGarza

#MakennaLeeElrod

#LaylaSalazar

#MaiteRodriguez

#AnnabellRodriguez

#EliahanaCruzTorres

#RojelioTorres

#AlithiaRamirez

#UziyahGarcia

You must listen to the incredible, comprehensive book "How to Stop A Mass Shooting Epidemic" by Professors Jillian Peterson and James Hensley. This is a "real world" book, not just theory not lecturing, and not political. Jill and James studied every mass shooter and context of every documented mass shooting in the United States. They interviewed shooters in prison who gave insight on what led them to their horrific crimes. But the book is about so much more. You can get it from the link below.

https://amzn.to/3z9jLxa

Links to the articles mentioned in our podcast can be found here:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2022/05/25/uvalde-texas-school-shooting-victims/

https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2022/05/28/us/school-shooting-timeline-uvalde-texas.html
